articles.title: Visualizing Mapping Models
articles.contents:
Contents
Prerequisites
Materials
Schedule
Resources
Contact

This workshop explores the role of visualization in data science workflows that use satellite imagery. We’ll get hands-on experience with how visualization can be used to support,
Data validation and cleaning
Model inspection and error analysis.
We’ll walk through a toy version of a glacier mapping problem. Using freely available Landsat imagery, we’ll train a model to recognize different types of glaciers.
Prerequisites
Basic familiarity with R
You should be able to enter the binder notebooks linked below
Materials
Binder Notebooks
Data preparation
Model training
Model visualization

Data
Raw data
Processed data

Results
Model
Predictions
Error rates

This workshop will be held on February 17, 2021.
